Posts.Content: waiting-to-exhale wrote: I am on my 6th round of chemo out of 8. It is going as well as possible. Very few side effects. I am doing dose dense ACT. I worry about relapse especially given that i am under 40, grade 3, multifocal, LVI and high oncotype score. Has anyone requested more chemo? Is there any point? I am wonder if a couple more rounds of a different protocol would help. My oncologist laughed when I asked and said she wouldnt discuss this until the end. Maybe my last few rounds will be more difficult? I just want to feel I did everything possible to prevent spread. My tumors grew so quickly, so I never had to be told it was aggressive. I knew. I just wonder if the existing length of protocols take into account people like me. Oncotype score 32 Dx 1/15/2015, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 2/3/2015 Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel; Mastectomy: Right; Reconstruction (right) Chemotherapy 3/20/2015 AC + T (Taxol) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Has anyone asked for more chemo? waiting-to-exhale inks

Posts.Content: May 18, 2015 12:34AM waiting-to-exhale wrote: after what we have all been through, its hard not to panic at any sign of a new lump. I was convinced I had some super aggressive, chemo resistant cancer growing. Thats good the radiologist says cancer the lump does not look like cancer. I hope it shrinks on its own so you can avoid biopsy. Please update once you know. I will keep my fingers crossed for you.
Posts.Title: New lump during chemo waiting-to-exhale MaryJC

Posts.Content: May 17, 2015 06:24PM waiting-to-exhale wrote: It turns out my swellings were boils/abscesses. For some reason, everytime I am neutropenic I get an infection in my armpit. I ended up hospitalized for 4 days to get it under contol and chemo was delayed a week. I just finished my 4th round of chemo and now take preventative antibiotics to keep from getting infections. I cant wait until chemo is over. I will probably be antibiotic resistant by then!
Posts.Title: New lump during chemo waiting-to-exhale MaryJC

Posts.Content: waiting-to-exhale wrote: I am a week and a half into my first round of chemotherapy and i have two swellings in my armpit. One almost the size of a ping pong ball. It appeared overnight. I went into the cancer emerg last night and confirmed that i am neutropenic. They didnt think it was cancer but thet also didnt know what it was and "hadnt seen this before". Of course I am worried this is new cancer. Anyone have words of wisdom for me Oncotype score 32 Dx 1/15/2015, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 2/3/2015 Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel; Mastectomy: Right; Reconstruction (right) Chemotherapy 3/20/2015 AC + T (Taxol) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New lump during chemo waiting-to-exhale MaryJC

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2015 01:02AM waiting-to-exhale wrote: no, I dont have any symptoms. I just didnt understand how cancer progresses. I am waiting for my pathology report back. I had a sentinel node biopsy done. Im just imagining all the different possibilities. Thanks for the answers.
Posts.Title: How cancer spreads? waiting-to-exhale

Posts.Content: Dec 25, 2014 01:30PM waiting-to-exhale wrote: Thanks Ariom for taking the time to respond. i am trying to keep busy as i am sure everyone else is. I need to limit the googling in a big way. Best wishes to everyone
Posts.Title: Birad 4c result on xmas eve waiting-to-exhale Ariom

Posts.Content: waiting-to-exhale wrote: my dr called with final mammogram report this afternoon. Birad 4c. Trying to be positive. Biopsy scheduled for january 7th which is the day before i leave on vacationwith husband and kids. Im so afraid to get bad results while away. Merry xmas everyone. Posts.Content: waiting-to-exhale wrote: My ultrasound report has indicated a 1.5 cm mass. Markedly hypoechoic, intrinsic calcifications, irregular margins and some acoustic enhancements. I have to wait a month for a biopsy. Not sure what to do? I'm panicking. This sounds like cancer to me. Anyone with similar results? I'm thinking of paying for a breast MRI while I wait for biopsy. Not sure if that will shed light on this. Waiting sucks. Good luck to everyone else waiting.
